Generation V.Black: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
Generation V.White: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
Generation V.Black 2: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn't notice attacks.
Generation V.White 2: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn't notice attacks.

Generation VI.X: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
Generation VI.Y: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

Generation VIII.Sword: Though they're still only babies, there's psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.
Generation VIII.Shield: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it's speaking to something only it can see.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.
Generation IX.Violet: Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.

Generation VIII.Sword: Giant's Cap Stony Wilderness , Watchtower Ruins ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Sword Expansion Pass: Slippery Slope , Frostpoint Field Giant's Bed , Snowslide Slope , Path to the Peak , Ballimere Lake ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.Scarlet: East Province: Area Three Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
Generation IX.Violet: East Province: Area Three Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
